intro: Boehmeria pachystachya, commonly known as giant arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can grow up to 30 cm in length. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers followed by triangular, fibrous fruits. Its rhizomes are used to produce a starchy, edible root that is similar to taro and arrowroot. The plant is also valued for its ornamental foliage and has traditional uses in various cultures.
